pull.title: travis: Run thread sanitizer on unit tests
pull.body: On unit tests only for now. Disabled for the gui unit tests and all functional tests.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#12134](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/12134.html) (Build previous releases and run functional tests by Sjors)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Strong concept ACK

We really should test under all sanitizers in Travis â€“ thanks for taking a step in that direction! :-)

rename.to: travis: Run thread sanitizer on unit tests

events.body:
Excellent work @MarcoFalke!

utACK modulo suggested changes

Would be really nice to also have the functional tests running under TSan :-)

events.message: test: Move UBSAN suppressions to test/sanitizer_suppressions/ubsan

issue.title: travis: Enable functional tests in the ThreadSanitizer (TSan) build job
issue.body:
Enable functional tests in the ThreadSanitizer (TSan) build job.

This is a follow-up to @MarcoFalke's #14764 which added TSan but for unit tests only.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -94,23 +94,24 @@ jobs:
         DEP_OPTS="NO_QT=1 NO_UPNP=1 DEBUG=1 ALLOW_HOST_PACKAGES=1"
         GOAL="install"
         BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-zmq --with-gui=qt5 --enable-glibc-back-compat --enable-reduce-exports --enable-debug CXXFLAGS=\"-g0 -O2\""
-# x86_64 Linux (xenial, no depends, only system libs)
+# x86_64 Linux (xenial, no depends, only system libs, sanitizers: thread (TSAN))
     - stage: test
       env: >-
         HOST=x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
         DOCKER_NAME_TAG=ubuntu:16.04
-        PACKAGES="python3-zmq qtbase5-dev qttools5-dev-tools libssl-dev libevent-dev bsdmainutils libboost-system-dev libboost-filesystem-dev libboost-chrono-dev libboost-test-dev libboost-thread-dev libdb5.3++-dev libminiupnpc-dev libzmq3-dev libprotobuf-dev protobuf-compiler libqrencode-dev"
+        PACKAGES="clang llvm python3-zmq qtbase5-dev qttools5-dev-tools libssl-dev libevent-dev bsdmainutils libboost-system-dev libboost-filesystem-dev libboost-chrono-dev libboost-test-dev libboost-thread-dev libdb5.3++-dev libminiupnpc-dev libzmq3-dev libprotobuf-dev protobuf-compiler libqrencode-dev"
         NO_DEPENDS=1
+        RUN_FUNCTIONAL_TESTS=false
comments.body:
What tests are blocking the removal of `RUN_FUNCTIONAL_TESTS=false`?

Can these be handled using suppressions instead?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -8,7 +8,8 @@ export LC_ALL=C.UTF-8
 
 PATH=$(echo $PATH | tr ':' "\n" | sed '/\/opt\/python/d' | tr "\n" ":" | sed "s|::|:|g")
 # Add llvm-symbolizer directory to PATH. Needed to get symbolized stack traces from the sanitizers.
-PATH=$PATH:/usr/lib/llvm-6.0/bin/
+# shellcheck disable=SC2125
+PATH=$PATH:/usr/lib/llvm-*/bin/
comments.body: I don't think this works. AFAIK wildcard paths are not allowed and this won't be expanded as intended.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -7,8 +7,9 @@
 export LC_ALL=C.UTF-8
 
 travis_retry docker pull "$DOCKER_NAME_TAG"
+export TSAN_OPTIONS="suppressions=${TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR}/test/sanitizer_suppressions/tsan"
 export UBSAN_OPTIONS="suppressions=${TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR}/contrib/sanitizers-ubsan.suppressions:print_stacktrace=1:halt_on_error=1"
comments.body: Also move from `contrib/sanitizers-ubsan.suppressions` to `test/sanitizer_suppressions/ubsan` to make it consistent across sanitizers?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -8,7 +8,8 @@ export LC_ALL=C.UTF-8
 
 PATH=$(echo $PATH | tr ':' "\n" | sed '/\/opt\/python/d' | tr "\n" ":" | sed "s|::|:|g")
 # Add llvm-symbolizer directory to PATH. Needed to get symbolized stack traces from the sanitizers.
-PATH=$PATH:/usr/lib/llvm-6.0/bin/
+# shellcheck disable=SC2125
+PATH=$PATH:/usr/lib/llvm-*/bin/
comments.body:
If there is only one folder that matches the wildcard, it should be properly expanded?

However, I just went and reverted that hunk.

         DEP_OPTS="NO_QT=1 NO_UPNP=1 DEBUG=1 ALLOW_HOST_PACKAGES=1"

+        PACKAGES="clang llvm python3-zmq qtbase5-dev qttools5-dev-tools libssl-dev libevent-dev bsdmainutils libboost-system-dev libboost-filesystem-dev libboost-chrono-dev libboost-test-dev libboost-thread-dev libdb5.3++-dev libminiupnpc-dev libzmq3-dev libprotobuf-dev protobuf-compiler libqrencode-dev"
         NO_DEPENDS=1
+        RUN_FUNCTIONAL_TESTS=false
comments.body: They also need to be identified, which is the tricky part and imo better be suited for another pull request. (See my WIP in the suppressions file)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -7,8 +7,9 @@
 export LC_ALL=C.UTF-8
 
 travis_retry docker pull "$DOCKER_NAME_TAG"
+export TSAN_OPTIONS="suppressions=${TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR}/test/sanitizer_suppressions/tsan"
 export UBSAN_OPTIONS="suppressions=${TRAVIS_BUILD_DIR}/contrib/sanitizers-ubsan.suppressions:print_stacktrace=1:halt_on_error=1"

@@ -8,7 +8,8 @@ export LC_ALL=C.UTF-8
 
 PATH=$(echo $PATH | tr ':' "\n" | sed '/\/opt\/python/d' | tr "\n" ":" | sed "s|::|:|g")
 # Add llvm-symbolizer directory to PATH. Needed to get symbolized stack traces from the sanitizers.
-PATH=$PATH:/usr/lib/llvm-6.0/bin/
+# shellcheck disable=SC2125
+PATH=$PATH:/usr/lib/llvm-*/bin/
comments.body:
@MarcoFalke No, the preceding `$PATH:` part prevents expansion:

```
$ mkdir testing
$ ls -d testin*
testing
$ TESTING=foo/:testin*
$ echo $TESTING
foo/:testin*
$ TESTING=testin*
$ echo $TESTING
testing
```

:-)
